original: Johansson, Oscar Wilhelm, byggmästare, Uddevalla, f. 23/1/77 i Svenstorp, Skarab. 1., av Johannes Larsson o. Maja Jonsson. G. 03 m. Maria Lindqvist. Barn: Märta f. 06, g. m. folkskoll. Wilhelm Strand, Uddevalla. — Genomg. tekn. sk. Byggmäsit. i Uddevalla. Led. av ’stadsfullm. i Uddevalla 16-47, av drätselikamm. :sed. 13, v. ordf. i byggnind 37-46, led. av löne-nd, pens:nd o. podisnd 30-32, suppl. i gas- o. elverksstyr. 22-30, ordf. 30-32, suppl. i landstinget 35-36, ordf, i Uddevalla byggmäst :fören. 27-45, led. av styr. f. Västra Sv:e’s byggmäst :förb., led. av folkpart. arb :utsk. f. länet 34-44, ordf. i lib. lokalavd. i Uddevalla 14 -24 o. i fris. avd. 24-32, led. av Uddevalla fastigh :äg:fören. 32-45, led. av Gustafsbergs barnhusdir. sed. 18. Hobby: myntsamhng. RVO 41.
translated: Johansson, Oscar Wilhelm, master builder, Uddevalla, b. January 23, 1877, in Svenstorp, Skaraborg County, son of Johannes Larsson and Maja Jonsson. Married in 1903 to Maria Lindqvist. Children: Märta, b. 1906, married to Wilhelm Strand, a primary school teacher in Uddevalla. Oscar Wilhelm went to technical school and became a master builder in Uddevalla. He was a member of the Uddevalla city council from 1916-1947, a member of the finance committee since 1913, deputy chairman of the building committee from 1937-1946, a member of the wage committee, pension committee and electric and gas power plant committee from 1930-1932, substitute member of the board for the electric and gas power plant from 1922-1930 and chairman from 1930-1932, substitute member of county council from 1935-1936, chairman of the Uddevalla master builder association from 1927-1945, member of the board of the Western Sweden master builder association, member of the liberal party's work committee for the county from 1934-1944, chairman of the liberal party's local department in Uddevalla from 1914-1924 and chairman of the free-thinking department from 1924-1932. He was also a member of the Uddevalla property owners association from 1932-1945 and a member of the Gustafsberg orphanage board since 1918. His hobby was collecting coins. He was awarded RVO in 1941.
